attributes.text:
The default resize behavior. Until a resize model is loaded, the default behavior is to:

  1. Upon the table initially appearing, and upon any window resize, divide the table space equally between the visible columns.
  2. When a column is increased in width, all columns to its right are pushed to the right with no change to their widths. This may push some columns off the right edge of the table, causing a horizontal scroll bar to appear.
  3. When a column is decreased in width, if the total width of all columns is greater than the table width, no additional column width change is made.
  4. When a column is decreased in width, if the total width of all columns is less than the table width, the visible column immediately to the right of the column which decreased in width has its width increased to fill the remaining space.

A resize model may be loaded to provide more guidance on how to adjust column width upon each of the events: initial appear, window resize, and column resize. *** TO BE FILLED IN ***
Clear all layout caches of the column datas.
Computes the width of all flexible children.
The event object.

If a column was just made invisible, extend the last column to fill any available space within the inner width of the table. This means that if the sum of the widths of all columns exceeds the inner width of the table, no change is made. If, on the other hand, the sum of the widths of all columns is less than the inner width of the table, the last column is extended to take up the width available within the inner width of the table.
The event object.

Extend the visible column to right of the column which just changed width, to fill any available space within the inner width of the table. This means that if the sum of the widths of all columns exceeds the inner width of the table, no change is made. If, on the other hand, the sum of the widths of all columns is less than the inner width of the table, the visible column to the right of the column which just changed width is extended to take up the width available within the inner width of the table.
Returns an array of the resizing information of a column.
array of the resizing information of a column.

Returns the (computed) value of the property initializeWidthsOnEveryAppear.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #initializeWidthsOnEveryAppear}.
(Computed) value of initializeWidthsOnEveryAppear.
This method is required by the box layout. If returns an array of items to relayout.
The list of column data object to layout.

Returns the (computed) value of the property newResizeBehaviorColumnData.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #newResizeBehaviorColumnData}.
(Computed) value of newResizeBehaviorColumnData.

Returns the (computed) value of the property tableColumnModel.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #tableColumnModel}.
(Computed) value of tableColumnModel.
Initial value for property initializeWidthsOnEveryAppear.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property initializeWidthsOnEveryAppear with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #initializeWidthsOnEveryAppear}.
the default value
Initial value for property newResizeBehaviorColumnData.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property newResizeBehaviorColumnData with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #newResizeBehaviorColumnData}.
the default value
Initial value for property tableColumnModel.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property tableColumnModel with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #tableColumnModel}.
the default value

Check whether the (computed) value of the boolean property initializeWidthsOnEveryAppear equals true.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #initializeWidthsOnEveryAppear}.
Whether the property equals true.

Resets the user value of the property initializeWidthsOnEveryAppear.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #initializeWidthsOnEveryAppear}.

Resets the user value of the property newResizeBehaviorColumnData.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #newResizeBehaviorColumnData}.

Resets the user value of the property tableColumnModel.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #tableColumnModel}.
The column whose attributes are to be changed

A map containing any or all of the property names “width”, “minWidth”, and “maxWidth”. The property values are as described for {@link #setWidth}, {@link #setMinWidth} and {@link #setMaxWidth} respectively.
Set any or all of the width, minimum width, and maximum width of a column in a single call.
Error is thrown if the provided column number is out of the range.
New value for property initializeWidthsOnEveryAppear.

Sets the user value of the property initializeWidthsOnEveryAppear.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #initializeWidthsOnEveryAppear}.
The unmodified incoming value.
The column whose maximum width is to be set
The maximum width of the specified column.
Set the maximum width of a column.
Error is thrown if the provided column number is out of the range.

Error is thrown if the provided column number is out of the range.

The unmodified incoming value.
The column whose width is to be set

The width of the specified column. The width may be specified as integer number of pixels (e.g. 100), a string representing percentage of the inner width of the Table (e.g. “25%”), or a string representing a flex width (e.g. “1*”).
Optional flex value of the column
Set the width of a column.
Error is thrown if the provided column number is out of the range.

Toggles the (computed) value of the boolean property initializeWidthsOnEveryAppear.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #initializeWidthsOnEveryAppear}.
the new value

Whether to reinitialize default widths on each appear event. Typically, one would want to initialize the default widths only upon the first appearance of the table, but the original behavior was to reinitialize it even if the table is hidden and then reshown (e.g. it’s in a pageview and the page is switched and then switched back).
A function to instantiate a resize behavior column data object.

The table column model in use. Of particular interest is the method getTable which is a reference to the table widget. This allows access to any other features of the table, for use in calculating widths of columns.
